definition: newsman/journalist (archaic)
to announce/to inform/report/newspaper/recompense/revenge/CL:份[fen4],張|张[zhang1]
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
recipient (of mail or a message)
sender (of a message)

sentences.english: The Anti-monopoly Authority shall maintain the confidentiality of the person making such report.
sentences.chinese: 反壟斷執法機構應當爲舉報人保密。

sentences.english: “We’vegone to where the guns are, ” an intelligence officer said.
sentences.chinese: “我們已經進入交戰區，”情報人員表示說。

sentences.english: I had consult my father (a professional tourism marketer and absolute authority in the industry around Yangtze river country) and my intelligence in Nanking for several times.
sentences.chinese: 我與家父和我在南京的情報人員進行了多次商討諮詢。

sentences.english: You mean you want to have them sent with charges to be collected from the addressee?
sentences.chinese: 你是說你想拍發這些電報並讓收報人付費？

sentences.english: The organ that accepts a tip-off shall keep confidential the tip-off maker as well as the tipped-off contents.
sentences.chinese: 接受舉報的機關應當對舉報人和舉報內容保密。

sentences.english: They wanted journalists to come here with a pack of intelligence guys.
sentences.chinese: 他們想把一整批情報人員混在記者羣中送進辛巴威來。

sentences.english: The sender may use whatever language permitted by the country of destination.
sentences.chinese: 發報人可以用收報國準用的任何語言。

sentences.english: Intelligence has〔have〕 reported that enemy is planning a new attack.
sentences.chinese: 情報人員報告說，敵軍正在策劃發動新攻勢。

sentences.english: During the Thrawn crisis, Imperial Intelligence agents framed Ackbar for an embezzlement scheme.
sentences.chinese: 在索龍危機期間，帝國情報人員誣陷阿克巴貪污。

sentences.english: American intelligence officers are trained to tackle tough targets.
sentences.chinese: 美國情報人員都被訓練來對付一些硬骨頭。

sentences.english: That whole building is packed with intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 整個建築物內遍佈情報人員。

sentences.english: Our spies report that troops are being moved to the border.
sentences.chinese: 我方諜報人員報告部隊正在向邊境調動。

sentences.english: the intelligence apparently helped their scientists build a miniaturized nuclear warhead.
sentences.chinese: 情報人員顯然地幫助了他們的科學家發展小型核彈頭。

sentences.english: That's one of the challenges of being a spy or case officer.
sentences.chinese: 這只不過是特工或諜報人員要面臨的考驗之一。

sentences.english: Chen Leng (Cheng Jinghan) was an influential journalist in the" late Qing Dynasty and Modern China."
sentences.chinese: 陳冷是近代中國著名的報人。

definition: to transcribe/to make a fair copy
accepted theory or formulation
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
a book on the art of war
manuscript of a book
to deliver/to send a letter/a letter (of complaint, opinion etc)

the Book of History, one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1], a compendium of documents which make up the oldest extant texts of Chinese history, from legendary times down to the time of Confucius, also known as 尚書經|尚书经[Shang4 shu1 jing1], 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], 書|书[Shu1]
to use up/to exhaust
insignificant talent/skill of no high order/minor accomplishment
Chen Yun (1905-1995), communist leader and economist
divine physician/sage doctor/highly skilled practitioner
to depart this life/to be no more
born at the wrong time (idiom); unlucky (esp. to complain about one's fate)/born under an unlucky star/ahead of his time
calligraphic style of Liu Gongquan
postal kiosk/(old) rest shelter for couriers
hanger-on/visitor (in a nobleman's house)
